title: Your Monday Briefing: The Social Cost of ‘Zero Covid’
description: Plus, Iran abolishes the morality police and Russia vows to defy an oil price cap.

title: Werner Franke, Who Exposed East German Doping Program, Dies at 82
description: In the 1990s, he and his wife unearthed documentary evidence of the illicit, state-sponsored drug program that propelled the country to Olympic glory.

title: Kremlin’s Defiance Adds Questions Over Whether Oil Price Cap Will Work
Iran Abolishes Morality Police After Months of Protests
description: The move appeared to be a concession to the protest movement that erupted after the death of Mahsa Amini, a young woman being held by the morality police for supposedly violating Islamic dress rules.

title: Macron Says Security Guarantees For Russia Are an ‘Essential’ Part of Peace Talks
A Strike, Averted
description: Congress stepped in to prevent supply chain havoc, but rail workers’ biggest grievance remains unaddressed.

title: Omega X Members Say Their K-pop Agency Mistreated Them
description: A public dispute between band members and the head of their agency has revived concerns about whether South Korean entertainment agencies exploit young musicians.

title: The Chinese Dream, Denied
description: The world’s harshest Covid restrictions exemplify how Xi Jinping’s authoritarian excesses have rewritten Beijing’s longstanding social contract with its people.

title: Arab Fans are Confronting Israeli Media at Qatar’s World Cup
description: When Qatar granted access to Israeli soccer fans and media despite an absence of diplomatic ties, some saw it as another sign of warming ties with the Arab world. Instead, some of the Israelis got a chilly reception.

title: The Texas Public Policy Foundation’s National Crusade Against Climate Action
description: The Texas Public Policy Foundation is shaping laws, running influence campaigns and taking legal action in a bid to promote fossil fuels.

title: In War, Ukrainians Forage for Mushrooms in Forests With Mines
description: These misty and damp parts of the country have long beckoned to mushroom hunters with the promise of plenty, but now peril, too, lies beneath the earth’s surface.

title: Zelensky Says Price Cap Set on Russian Oil Is Too High
description: Ukraine’s president criticized the $60-a-barrel limit set by the Group of 7 nations, suggesting that the architects of the plan were “trying to avoid big decisions.”
